title: Youth unemployment rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Unemployment rate for 20 number of Months.
The Unemployment rate is appeared to be the highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
There is a difference of 41.7 between the maximum Month Sicily and minimum Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Unemployment rate for 20 number of Months.
Month Sicily has the highest Unemployment rate and Trentino-South Tyrol has the lowest Unemployment rate.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Unemployment rate for 20 number of Months.
The Unemployment rate is appeared to be the highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
There is a difference of 41.7 between the maximum Month Sicily and minimum Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Unemployment rate in each Month on the y axis.
The Unemployment rate is highest at Month Sicily and lowest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
Second maximum Unemployment rate is found at Month Campania.
The highest Month Sicily has 41.7 more Unemployment rate than the lowest Month Trentino-South Tyrol.
Month Sicily is higher than any other Months with value 53.6, followed by Campania, and Calabria. Down to Month Trentino-South Tyrol with the lowest value 11.9.
Over the past 20 Months, the Unemployment rate has reduced.
Month Sicily, and Campania have a similar Unemployment rate that is 53.6.
The Month Sicily has 1.67 times more Unemployment rate than average.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 641.7.
